utils/LinearAlgebra.h

00001 /* LinearAlgebra.h - solves least-squares problems nicely */
00002 /* Taken from ImageStack, licensed under the BSD license  */
00003 /* http://code.google.com/p/imagestack/                   */
00004 
00005 #ifndef IMAGESTACK_LINEARALGEBRA_H
00006 #define IMAGESTACK_LINEARALGEBRA_H
00007 #include <stdio.h>
00008 #include <math.h>
00009 
00010 namespace ImageStack {
00011 
00012 /* 
00013 
00014 This class takes a set of vectors of length N and vectors of length M,
00015 and computes the best (least-squares) matrix that maps from the first
00016 set to the second. Ie, given a bunch of examples, it solves Ax = b for
00017 A. Written this way, it returns A in *column-major* format.
00018 
00019 You construct a solver that maps from N dimensional vectors to M
00020 dimensional vectors like so:
00021 
00022 LeastSquaresSolver<N, M> solver;
00023 
00024 One of the two methods is:
00025 
00026 void solver.addCorrespondence(float *, float *);
00027 
00028 which takes two example vectors and updated some internal state. You
00029 may also pass a weight as an optional third argument. There is also a
00030 double version of this method, so floats aren't necessary.
00031 
00032 The other method is:
00033 
00034 bool solver.solve(double *);
00035 
00036 which fills in the argument with the best matrix in column major
00037 format. It will return false if not enough examples have been
00038 given (or if they are linearly dependent), otherwise it returns true.
00039 
00040 It operates efficiently in space, using O(N*N)+O(M*N) memory,
00041 regardless of how many examples are given, so feel free to go nuts
00042 with examples. It is also efficient in time, using a direct Cholesky
00043 decomposition to do the final solve.
00044 
00045 Example Usage:
00046 
00047 Say we wish to compute an affine warp from some 2D set of vectors x to
00048 some other 2D set of vectors y.
00049 
00050 -----------------------------------------------------------
00051 LeastSquaresSolver<3, 2> solver;
00052 
00053 // these could also be doubles
00054 float x[3], y[2];
00055 
00056 while (there are more examples) {
00057    // do something to fill in x[0], x[1], y[0], y[1] with the next example input and output
00058    
00059    // set x[2] to 1, because we're computing an affine transformation using a matrix
00060    x[2] = 1;
00061 
00062    solver.addCorrespondence(x, y);
00063 }
00064 
00065 double matrix[2*3];
00066 
00067 if (!solver.solve(matrix)) {
00068   // underconstrained
00069 }
00070 // matrix now contains the best affine transform in column major order
00071 -----------------------------------------------------------
00072 
00073 Say we wish to instead compute a polynomial map from x to y, where y can
00074 include quadratic terms in x:
00075 
00076 -----------------------------------------------------------
00077 LeastSquaresSolver<6, 2> solver;
00078 
00079 float x[6], y[2];
00080 
00081 while (there are more examples) {
00082    // do something to fill in x[0], x[1], y[0], y[1] with the next example
00083    
00084    // fill in the rest of the quadratic terms
00085    x[2] = 1;
00086    x[3] = x[0]*x[0];
00087    x[4] = x[0]*x[1];
00088    x[5] = x[1]*x[1];
00089 
00090    solver.addCorrespondence(x, y);
00091 }
00092 
00093 double m[2*6];
00094 
00095 if (!solver.solve(m)) {
00096    // underconstrained!
00097 }
00098 
00099 // m now contains the best quadratic transform in column major order
00100 // ie it contains the values that best make these equations true:
00101 
00102 // y0 = m0*x0 + m2*x1 + m4*x2 + m6*x3 + m8*x4 + m10*x5
00103 // y1 = m1*x0 + m3*x1 + m5*x2 + m7*x3 + m9*x4 + m11*x5
00104 
00105 // or, equivalently:
00106 
00107 // y0 = m0*x0 + m2*x1 + m4 + m6*x0*x0 + m8*x0*x1 + m10*x1*x1
00108 // y1 = m1*x0 + m3*x1 + m5 + m7*x0*x0 + m9*x0*x1 + m11*x1*x1
00109 
00110 -----------------------------------------------------------
00111 
00112 
00113 */
00114 
00115 template<int N, int M>
00116 class LeastSquaresSolver {
00117 public:    
00118     // stored row major
00119     double AtA[N*N];
00120     double Atb[N*M];
00121 
00122     LeastSquaresSolver() {
00123         reset();
00124     }
00125 
00126     void reset() {
00127         for (int i = 0; i < N*N; i++) {
00128             AtA[i] = 0;
00129         }
00130         for (int i = 0; i < N*M; i++) {
00131             Atb[i] = 0;
00132         }
00133     }
00134 
00135     void addCorrespondence(float *in, float *out, float weight) {
00136         // update AtA
00137         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00138             for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {
00139                 AtA[i*N+j] += in[i]*in[j]*weight;
00140             }
00141         }        
00142 
00143         // update Atb
00144         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00145             for (int j = 0; j < M; j++) {
00146                 Atb[i*M+j] += in[i]*out[j]*weight;
00147             }
00148         }        
00149     }
00150 
00151     void addCorrespondence(float *in, float *out) {
00152         // update AtA
00153         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00154             for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {
00155                 AtA[i*N+j] += in[i]*in[j];
00156             }
00157         }        
00158 
00159         // update Atb
00160         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00161             for (int j = 0; j < M; j++) {
00162                 Atb[i*M+j] += in[i]*out[j];
00163             }
00164         }        
00165     }
00166 
00167     void addCorrespondence(double *in, double *out, double weight) {
00168         // update AtA
00169         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00170             for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {
00171                 AtA[i*N+j] += in[i]*in[j]*weight;
00172             }
00173         }        
00174 
00175         // update Atb
00176         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00177             for (int j = 0; j < M; j++) {
00178                 Atb[i*M+j] += in[i]*out[j]*weight;
00179             }
00180         }        
00181     }
00182 
00183     void addCorrespondence(double *in, double *out) {
00184         // update AtA
00185         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00186             for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {
00187                 AtA[i*N+j] += in[i]*in[j];
00188             }
00189         }        
00190 
00191         // update Atb
00192         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00193             for (int j = 0; j < M; j++) {
00194                 Atb[i*M+j] += in[i]*out[j];
00195             }
00196         }        
00197     }
00198 
00199     // returns whether or not it succeeded
00200     bool solve(double *solution) {
00201         bool isspd = true;
00202 
00203         double L[N*N];
00204         for (int i = 0; i < N*N; i++) {
00205             L[i] = 0.0;
00206         }
00207         // compute cholesky decomposition A = L'*L
00208         for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {
00209             double d = 0.0;
00210             for (int k = 0; k < j; k++) {
00211                 double s = 0.0;
00212                 for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
00213                     s += L[k*N+i]*L[j*N+i];
00214                 }
00215                 L[j*N+k] = s = (AtA[j*N+k] - s)/L[k*N+k];
00216                 d = d + s*s;
00217                 isspd = isspd && (AtA[k*N+j] == AtA[j*N+k]); 
00218             }
00219             d = AtA[j*N+j] - d;
00220             isspd = isspd && (d > 0.0);
00221             L[j*N+j] = sqrt(d > 0.0 ? d : 0.0);
00222             for (int k = j+1; k < N; k++) {
00223                 L[j*N+k] = 0.0;
00224             }
00225         }                
00226 
00227         // bail if not symmetric positive definite
00228         if (!isspd) return false;
00229 
00230         for (int i = 0; i < M*N; i++) solution[i] = Atb[i];
00231 
00232         // apply the decomposition to produce a solution
00233         // Solve L*y = b;
00234         for (int j = 0; j < M; j++) {
00235             for (int k = 0; k < N; k++) {
00236                 for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) 
00237                     solution[j+k*M] -= solution[j+i*M]*L[k*N+i];
00238                 solution[j+k*M] /= L[k*N+k];            
00239             }
00240 
00241             // Solve L'*X = Y;
00242             for (int k = N-1; k >= 0; k--) {
00243                 for (int i = k+1; i < N; i++) 
00244                     solution[j+k*M] -= solution[j+i*M]*L[i*N+k];
00245                 solution[j+k*M] /= L[k*N+k];
00246             }
00247         }
00248 
00249 
00250         return true;
00251     }    
00252 };
00253 
00254 }
00255 #endif
